Text.Value: I... guess I'm glad you told me. If you were a dyed-in-the-wool evil Sharran skulker, you'd've kept that close to the chest.
I can see you're a good person. But good people can do terrible things if they get mixed up in the wrong situation.
Karlach. I worship Shar. There. I've said it.
We've become close, and there's something I want you to know. I worship Shar, the Lady of Loss.
Change your mind - better not to discuss it.
I respect that you told me, though. Maybe the Lady of Loss doesn't have a total chokehold on you. Consider my judgment reserved.
Gods. Shar? She's fucking evil, Shadowheart.
Well. Yes you did.

EditorData.NodeContext: In response to 'Karlach. I worship Shar. There. I said it.' Karlach is taken aback and processing this.

Text.Value: Consider my judgement reserved. For now.
I won't lie, this makes me a little uneasy. But I've met far worse operators than you, Shadowheart.

EditorData.NodeContext: Making nice a little. But still wary.

Text.Value: *She'll understand, won't she? You've gotten on so well so far.*
Thanks for trusting me, Shadowheart. It means a lot to me that you feel I've earned it.
To be honest, I don't know much about Shar. About what her followers believe and don't believe. But if they're mostly like you... well, maybe Shar's gotten an unfair reputation.
Karlach, there's something I want you to know. I worship Shar, the Lady of Loss.
Sorry, I'm just... I mean, it's not that I didn't suspect... but... now here it is. In the open.

EditorData.NodeContext: Still processing. Talking while trying to understand. Not totally positive.

Text.Value: All right. Well. Look - I care about who you are, not which god you worship. But... gods, Shar?
*Karlach seems a sensible sort. She might be pragmatic...*
Then again, the fact that you're telling me at all means something, doesn't it? Sharrans love a secret. And you're honest, if nothing else.
I'm glad you trusted me enough to tell me. That means something to me.
I won't lie, I had my suspicions. But you seemed... I don't know. Not as bad as Shar.
*Then again, you've disagreed enough so far. Maybe another dispute could be the last.*
I'll be honest - I suspected as much. I was hoping you'd tell me yourself. And hey! You did.
There we have it. I'll be honest with you - I suspected as much. Wasn't sure you were going to tell me, though.

Synopsis: Shadowheart confronts Karlach about her relationship with Shar
